attributes.comment: The American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA) is the national professional association representing the interests of more than 244,500 occupational therapists, occupational therapy assistants, and students of occupational therapy. During delivery of occupational therapy services, occupational therapy (OT) practitioners frequently coordinate and collaborate with other healthcare providers and payers to obtain referrals, facilitate authorizations for occupational therapy services, and participate in patient care transitions. AOTA appreciates the opportunity to comment on CMS’s efforts to improve care communication and reduce delays in attaining necessary medical services through implementation of a national directory of healthcare providers and services (NDH) and its potential impact to OT practitioners. Please refer to the attached comment letter for details.

attributes.title: Comment on CMS-2022-0163-0001
